title: How to Have Fun and Take Care of a Baby Doll

steps.headline: Name your doll something cute and lovable.
steps.description: Remember it is your choice. You can check baby name websites for a great selection of names. If you want a unique name, you can find a site where you can exclude the most popular names. If you are interested in popular names you can take a look at those too. You can use flower names like Rose or a name that rhymes or corresponds with your name. Do a "today" name like Olivia or a "yesterday" name like Abigail. If you just wanna have fun do a name that you just made up with your imagination.

steps.headline: Get clothes for your doll.
steps.description: You could buy the clothes for your doll without spending a lot of money. If you want cheap and good quality clothes to shop for real baby clothes. You can pay great prices and receive cute clothes at your local thrift store or on eBay. Baby clothes are better quality because they are made to go on real skin and not plastic. You can also make your clothes. You can get really cute fabrics for your doll and find easy tutorials.

steps.headline: Make the baby doll comfortable when you first get it.
steps.description: Let it sleep with you for a week or so. Then make it a bed. Use small baby blankets and bits of fabrics for a cozy bed. Add some stuffed animals for a fun bedtime and place the bed for your doll close to your own. Love your doll so that it can feel happy and loved.

steps.headline: Wake your bundle of joy gently.
steps.description: A light shake will do it. Try and whisper something to it like, "Good morning sweetie, time to get up and start the day." Make sure her wake up isn't a harsh slap or a dreadful alarm clock or a light hurting its eyes. Gently pull up the covers and pick your doll up gently. Then you can turn on the lights when your baby is awake.

steps.headline: Feed it a bottle or some mushy food.
steps.description: Be creative add a fun juice or some silly pancakes. You want your doll to feel well fed. This is breakfast, the most important meal of the day, right? If it refuses to eat, try and feed it later. It might not be hungry. If it starts to cry it is a sign it doesn't want food. Gently clean the doll up and then try again later.

steps.headline: Rock it in your arms and burp it.
steps.description: Since it just ate, slowly rock the baby doll to comfort it. Then when its food digests, you may burp the baby if gassy.

steps.headline: Change its diaper.
steps.description: Take off its old one, clean it up, and put a new one back on. Clean up the mess. You know the drill.

steps.headline: Get it dressed.
steps.description: Pick out a cute, comfy outfit that it likes or wants to wear. If you want, take a picture of it in the adorable little outfit and have fun doing dress up!

steps.headline: Start the day.
steps.description: Decide what you going to do with your doll that day. Take your doll places as if it were a part of the family. Take it on picnics or walks, to the grocery store, or a relative's house. If you are going somewhere you can't take your baby to, ask a friend, older sister, or even a grown-up or teenager doll (or even teddy bear) to babysit your doll.

steps.headline: Play with your doll.
steps.description: Get out your toys and let it mess around. It'll have a great time! Take lots of pictures!

steps.headline: Feed it some lunch.
steps.description: Once again, it can be a bottle, or some mushy food if it's 10 months or older.

steps.headline: Change its diaper again.
steps.description: You know the drill.

steps.headline: Have cuddle time.
steps.description: Snuggle with your doll on the couch or a carpet and talk to it. Bring a small book to read or a toy to play with for the time to pass.

steps.headline: Go outside.
steps.description: Don't forget to put on its sunscreen if its hot outside. If possible, go to the park and push it on the baby swings, go down the slide with it, or teach it how to climb a ladder. If you can't, bring out a small ball and watch it have a blast.

steps.headline: Let it nap.
steps.description: Your cutie pie must be exhausted from all that fun, it's nap time. Lay it in its crib and let it fall asleep. If it's having trouble, rock it in your arms before you put it in the crib and it will be well-rested.

steps.headline: Feed it dinner.
steps.description: Perhaps a small bottle should do it.

steps.headline: Bathe the doll.
steps.description: Pretend to put it in the bathtub and use fake shampoo and body wash.

steps.headline: Read it a bedtime story.
steps.description: Choose a fairy tale or make something up.

steps.headline: Sing the doll a lullaby.
steps.description: Rock the doll in your arms and sing a soft song to your sensational sweetheart.

steps.headline: Put the doll to bed.
steps.description: Now that it's knocked out cold in your arms, gently lay it down in its crib and kiss it goodnight.

steps.headline: If you are lucky enough to have multiple babysitter choices, you have to choose one just like a real parent.
steps.description: First set up a time when each potential employee can come and be interviewed.

steps.headline: Usually, these people would not do anything wrong with a baby doll.
steps.description: But, you must still compare your options in both sitter experience and cost, if there is a cost. If one has real baby experience, but the other only has a baby doll experience, does that matter? Choose the one with only baby doll experience, unless her services cost significantly more than the other.

steps.headline: If you suspect a sitter is bad, trust your gut.
steps.description: It's safest for you and your baby doll.

steps.headline: Do this same thing when choosing a doctor for her.
steps.description: Medications for sicknesses can usually be cured at home but check-ups can't happen at home. If a friend has a baby doll or toy health experience you could ask her.

steps.headline: Clean the doll.
steps.description: If your doll gets dirty, do not put it in the bathtub. Instead, use baking soda. Use a damp washcloth and rub on the powder. Then use a dry towel to wipe it all off.

steps.headline: If the doll came from a thrift store and you want to disinfect her (you never know how much dirt and baby slobber could have gotten on her), try this trick.
steps.description: Undress your doll. Take a baby wipe, and put some disinfecting hand sanitizer on it. Rub it in, then rub this wipe all over your doll until she is slightly wet all over. Let her dry (it should only take a few minutes) then dress her.

text: Steps Name your doll something cute and lovable. Remember it is your choice. You can check baby name websites for a great selection of names. If you want a unique name, you can find a site where you can exclude the most popular names. If you are interested in popular names you can take a look at those too. You can use flower names like Rose or a name that rhymes or corresponds with your name. Do a "today" name like Olivia or a "yesterday" name like Abigail. If you just wanna have fun do a name that you just made up with your imagination. Get clothes for your doll. You could buy the clothes for your doll without spending a lot of money. If you want cheap and good quality clothes to shop for real baby clothes. You can pay great prices and receive cute clothes at your local thrift store or on eBay. Baby clothes are better quality because they are made to go on real skin and not plastic. You can also make your clothes. You can get really cute fabrics for your doll and find easy tutorials. Make the baby doll comfortable when you first get it. Let it sleep with you for a week or so. Then make it a bed. Use small baby blankets and bits of fabrics for a cozy bed. Add some stuffed animals for a fun bedtime and place the bed for your doll close to your own. Love your doll so that it can feel happy and loved. In The Morning Wake your bundle of joy gently. A light shake will do it. Try and whisper something to it like, "Good morning sweetie, time to get up and start the day." Make sure her wake up isn't a harsh slap or a dreadful alarm clock or a light hurting its eyes. Gently pull up the covers and pick your doll up gently. Then you can turn on the lights when your baby is awake. Feed it a bottle or some mushy food. Be creative add a fun juice or some silly pancakes. You want your doll to feel well fed. This is breakfast, the most important meal of the day, right? If it refuses to eat, try and feed it later. It might not be hungry. If it starts to cry it is a sign it doesn't want food. Gently clean the doll up and then try again later. Rock it in your arms and burp it. Since it just ate, slowly rock the baby doll to comfort it. Then when its food digests, you may burp the baby if gassy. Change its diaper. Take off its old one, clean it up, and put a new one back on. Clean up the mess. You know the drill. Get it dressed. Pick out a cute, comfy outfit that it likes or wants to wear. If you want, take a picture of it in the adorable little outfit and have fun doing dress up! Start the day. Decide what you going to do with your doll that day. Take your doll places as if it were a part of the family. Take it on picnics or walks, to the grocery store, or a relative's house. If you are going somewhere you can't take your baby to, ask a friend, older sister, or even a grown-up or teenager doll (or even teddy bear) to babysit your doll. In The Afternoon Play with your doll. Get out your toys and let it mess around. It'll have a great time! Take lots of pictures! Feed it some lunch. Once again, it can be a bottle, or some mushy food if it's 10 months or older. Change its diaper again. You know the drill. Have cuddle time. Snuggle with your doll on the couch or a carpet and talk to it. Bring a small book to read or a toy to play with for the time to pass. Go outside. Don't forget to put on its sunscreen if its hot outside. If possible, go to the park and push it on the baby swings, go down the slide with it, or teach it how to climb a ladder. If you can't, bring out a small ball and watch it have a blast. Let it nap. Your cutie pie must be exhausted from all that fun, it's nap time. Lay it in its crib and let it fall asleep. If it's having trouble, rock it in your arms before you put it in the crib and it will be well-rested. In The Evening Feed it dinner. Perhaps a small bottle should do it. Bathe the doll. Pretend to put it in the bathtub and use fake shampoo and body wash. Change its diaper.  Read it a bedtime story. Choose a fairy tale or make something up. Sing the doll a lullaby. Rock the doll in your arms and sing a soft song to your sensational sweetheart. Put the doll to bed. Now that it's knocked out cold in your arms, gently lay it down in its crib and kiss it goodnight. Choosing a Babysitter If you are lucky enough to have multiple babysitter choices, you have to choose one just like a real parent. First set up a time when each potential employee can come and be interviewed. Usually, these people would not do anything wrong with a baby doll. But, you must still compare your options in both sitter experience and cost, if there is a cost. If one has real baby experience, but the other only has a baby doll experience, does that matter? Choose the one with only baby doll experience, unless her services cost significantly more than the other. If you suspect a sitter is bad, trust your gut. It's safest for you and your baby doll. Do this same thing when choosing a doctor for her. Medications for sicknesses can usually be cured at home but check-ups can't happen at home. If a friend has a baby doll or toy health experience you could ask her. Keeping the Doll Clean Clean the doll. If your doll gets dirty, do not put it in the bathtub. Instead, use baking soda. Use a damp washcloth and rub on the powder. Then use a dry towel to wipe it all off. If the doll came from a thrift store and you want to disinfect her (you never know how much dirt and baby slobber could have gotten on her), try this trick. Undress your doll. Take a baby wipe, and put some disinfecting hand sanitizer on it. Rub it in, then rub this wipe all over your doll until she is slightly wet all over. Let her dry (it should only take a few minutes) then dress her.
